detailed_results.ocr_text:
=== PAGE 1 ===
DEED BOOK No. 475
646

The authority therein conferred upon him, acknowledged said deed to be theact and deed of the said Harbison-Walker Refractories Company, and desired that the same might be recorded as such.

WITNESS my hand and Notarial seal, the day and year aforesaid.
(NOTARIAL SEAL)                                Alice A. Trill
My commission expires January 22, 1921.        Notary Public.
Recorded and compared Jan. 24, 1920.          August Valentour, Recorder.    Per H. D.

CHARLES L. CRISS, ET. UX. ET. AL.    THIS INDENTURE MADE this 11th day of September A.D.1919,
TO                                   between MARY E. CRISS, unmarried, of Eldersville, Washington County, Pennsylvania; STEWART W. CRISS and MARY E.
GRANT BOYCE                          CRISS, his wife, of Steubenville, Ohio; ELMER R. CRISS and BETTIE CRISS, his wife, of New Kensington, Pennsylvania,

CHARLES L. CRISS and LUCY CRISS, his wife, of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; ROBERT W. CRISS and EMMA CRISS, his wife, of Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania; NICHOLAS F. CRISS and ANNA SCOTT CRISS, his wife, of the City of Pittsburgh, County of Allegheny and State of Pennsylvania, and HALLIE CRISS TAYLOR and ALBERT A. TAYLOR, her husband, of Midway, Pennsylvania, parties of the first part, and GRANT BOYCE of the Township of Jefferson, County of Washington, State of Pennsylvania, party of the second part,

WITNESSETH, that the said parties of the first part, in consideration of One Dollar ($1.00) and other valuable considerations, to them now paid by the said party of the second part, do grant, bargain, sell and convey unto the said party of the second part, his heirs and assigns,

ALL that certain tract or piece of land situate in Jefferson and Hanover Townships, Washington County, Pennsylvania, bounded and described as follows:-

BEGINNING at a corner common to land now or formerly of A. M. Fell and the land hereinafter described; thence by land of A. M. Fell North 74° West, fifty-two and two tenths (52.2) perches to a stone; thence by same North 89° West, seventy-five and five tenths (75.5) perches to a stone on line of land of John A. Bell (formerly of John Melvin); thence by said land North 4° East, sixty-four and four tenths (64.4) perches to a stone on line of land now or formerly of Retta McMurray; thence by said land South 89 5/8° East, sixty-six and four tenths (66.4) perches to a stone; thence by same and land formerly of William McKnight North 74° West, crossing Harmon's Creek, one hundred twelve and nine tenths (112.9) perches to a stone; thence by said land formerly of McKnight North 56½° East sixty-five and two tenths (65.2) perches to a stone on line of land conveyed by the parties of the first part hereto Thomas and Frank M. Sankey by deed recorded in Deed Book, Vol. 204, page 266; thence by said last mentioned land South 3/4° East seventy-nine (79) perches to a stone on line of other land of Sankey (formerly of Charles Hamlin; thence by said last mentioned land North 7 3/4° West, thirty-six (36) perches to a stone in Harmon's Creek as formerly located; thence along the old location of said Harmons's Creek South 864° East, fifteen and two tenths (15.2) perches to a stone on line of land of John A. Bell, formerly of the Keystone Coal Company; thence by said land South 55° East crossing the P. C. C. & St. L. R. R., seventy-seven (77) perches to a stone; thence by same South 19½° East, sixty-five and nine tenths (65.9) perches to a stone near the lower side of the public road; thence by land of M. T. Boles (formerly of William Boles), South 70 7/8° West, twenty-eight and two tenths (28.2) perches to a stone above the public road; thence by same South 26½° West, thirty and eight tenths (30.8) perches to a stone; thence by same land and land now or formerly of A. M. Fell, North 72° West, thirty-four and four tenths (34.4) perches

=== PAGE 2 ===
DEED BOOK No. 475
647

to a stone; thence by said Bell land South 70 7/8° West, forty-four and eight tenths (44.8) perches to the place of beginning.

Containing one hundred fifty-one (151) acres one hundred fifty-seven (157) perches, more or less.

BEING a part of the same tract of land of which Rittenhouse Criss died seized, intestate leaving to survive as his only heirs at law, a widow, Eliza J. Criss, since deceased, and eight children, viz, Mary M. Criss, Stewart W. Criss, Elmer R. Criss, Charles L. Criss, Anna R. Criss Robert W. Criss, Nicholas R. Criss and Hallie E. Criss, since intermarried with Albert A. Taylor; the said Anna R. Criss having died on or about the 27th day of June, 1899, intestate, unmarried and without issue, leaving to survive as her only heirs at law, her mother, the said Eliza J. Criss, now deceased and her brothers and sister above named.

EXCEPTING AND RESERVING therefrom and thereout four and three hundred nineteen thousandths (4.319) acres of said land, heretofore conveyed to the Pittsburgh, Cincinnati, Chicago and St. Louis Railway Company, by deed dated August 11, 1913, and recorded in Deed Book, Vol. 410, page 454, and so much of the Pittsburgh or River vein of coal, with roster coal, if any, as was heretofore conveyed by M. R. Criss, to John A. Bell (see also deed from Mary M. Criss et. al. to M. R. Criss, dated February 26, 1917, recorded in Deed Book, Vol. 442, page 661), together with all veins of coal below the Pittsburgh vein, with mining rights in connection with each of said veins of coal as follows:-

Together with the free and uninterrupted right of way into, upon and under said land, at such points and in such manner as may be proper and necessary for the purpose of digging, mining, draining and ventilating and carrying away said coal, etc., without liability for surface damages, or damages of any sort arising therefrom, or from the removal of all of said coal; together with the privilege of mining and removing through said described premises other coal belonging to said parties of the first part, their heirs or assigns, or which they may hereafter acquire.

EXCEPTING AND RESERVING, ALSO, all the petroleum oil and natural gas in and under said premises, together with the right of ingress and egress at all times for the exclusive purpose of drilling and operating for oil and gas, with the right to use water from the premises for this purpose and to lay, re-lay, erect, maintain and remove all pipes, structures and tanks, and operate such machinery and devices as may be necessary for the production and transportation of oil, gas and water. Provided, however, that no well shall be drilled in that portion of said premises containing about five acres, lying south of the public road in front of the dwelling house, and bounded by the public road and by land of M. T. Boles or within two hundred feet of any of the farm buildings, except by mutual consent. The sum of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) shall be paid to the owner of said land for each well drilled above the crop line of the Pittsburgh vein of coal.

This conveyance is made subject to all the mining rights, waivers, &c., contained in the deed from Mary M. Criss et al. to M. R. Criss, and in the deed from M. R. Criss to John A. Bell above referred to.

With the appurtenances: TO HAVE AND TO HOLD the same unto and for the use of the said party of the second part, his heirs and assigns forever.

And the said Mary M. Criss, Stewart W. Criss, Elmer R. Criss, Charles L. Criss, Robert W. Criss, Nicholas R. Criss and Hallie Criss Taylor, for themselves, their heirs, executors and administrators, covenant with the said party of the second part, his heirs and assigns, against all lawful claimants the same and every part thereof to warrant and defend.

WITNESS the hands and seals of the said parties of the first part.

ATTEST:
P. H. Mollenauer

Charles L. Criss (SEAL)
Lucy J. Criss (SEAL)

detailed_samples.reasoning: This document contains clear and explicit mineral rights reservations. Here are the specific substantive reservations:
This document contains clear and explicit mineral rights reservations. Here are the specific substantive reservations:

WITNESSETH, that the said parties of the first part, in consideration of One Dollar ($1.00) and other valuable considerations, to them now paid by the said party of the second part, do grant, bargain, sell and convey unto the said party of the second part, his heirs and assigns,

ALL that certain tract or piece of land situate in Jefferson and Hanover Townships, Washington County, Pennsylvania, bounded and described as follows:-

BEGINNING at a corner common to land now or formerly of A. M. Fell and the land hereinafter described; thence by land of A. M. M. Fell, North 72° West, thirty-four and four tenths (34.4) perches

DEED BOOK No. 475
647

to a stone; thence by said Bell land South 70 7/8° West, forty-four and eight tenths (44.8) perches to the place of beginning.

detailed_results.ocr_text:
=== PAGE 1 ===
ALLEGHENY COUNTY PENNSYLVANIA DEED BOOK VOLUME 2470 179

Indenture to be their act and deed, to the end that it may be recorded as such.
WITNESS my hand and official seal.
Mabel A. Hazlett, Notary Public. (N. P. Seal)
My com. expires Feb. 26, 1933.

CERTIFICATE OF RESIDENCE
I, Frank X. Ciescielski, do hereby certify that my precise residence is Harwick, Pa.
WITNESS my hand this 16th day of May, 1932.
Francis X. McCulloch,
Atty. for Frank X. Ciescielski, et ux.

Registered in Allegheny County, June 6, 1932.
No. 13901. Recorded June 6, 1932. Time 10:36 A.M.
Written by McCormick; Compared by [signatures]

THIS INDENTURE
MAE E. JONES TO ORA R. PITTS, ET UX.

MADE the sixteenth day of September in the year of our Lord one thousand nine hundred and thirty-one (1931). Between MAE E. JONES, widow, (being the widow of George W. Jones, deceased), of Jefferson Township, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, party of the first part and ORA R. PITTS and IRENE A. PITTS, his wife, of Dravosburg, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, parties of the second part.

WITNESSETH, that the said party of the first part, in consideration of One ($1.00) Dollar, and other good and valuable considerations, to her paid by the said parties of the second part, does grant, bargain, sell and convey unto the said parties of the second part, their heirs and assigns:

ALL that certain tract or piece of land situate partly in Union Township, in the County of Washington, and State of Pennsylvania, and partly in Jefferson Township, in County of Allegheny, and State aforesaid, bounded and described as follows, to-wit:

[Detailed property description with measurements follows]

THIS conveyance is made under and subject to that certain oil and gas lease covering the above described land as now held and owned by Carnegie Natural Gas Company. And party of the first part excepts and reserves to herself, her heirs, executors, administrators, and assigns, forever, out of and from the force and effect of this conveyance all the rents, royalties, income, and profit which are or may arise from and by virtue of the aforesaid oil and gas lease. And in the event the said Carnegie Natural Gas Company, its successors or assigns, should at any time hereafter cancel or surrender said oil and gas lease covering the above described land, then, in such event, all the oil and gas in and under the above described land, together with all the wells drilled by virtue of said lease, shall revert to and become the property of the party of the first part, her heirs, executors, administrators, and assigns, in fee simple and absolutely, together with such rights and privileges, in the above described land which may be necessary and required in any and all operations for the drilling and operating for oil and gas in said premises as fully and completely and to the same extent as set forth in said written oil and gas lease held by the said Carnegie Natural Gas Company aforesaid in the said land.

[Additional terms regarding mortgage and property rights follow]

WITH the appurtenances: TO HAVE AND TO HOLD the same unto and for the use of said parties of the second part, their heirs and assigns forever, subject, however, to the exceptions, reservations, conditions, and stipulations hereinabove mentioned and referred to.

Francis X. McCulloch,
Atty. for Frank X. Ciescielski, et ux.

Registered in Allegheny County, June 6, 1932.
No. 13901. Recorded June 6, 1932. Time 10:36 A.M.
Written by McCormick; Compared by [signatures]

MAE E. JONES TO ORA R. PITTS, ET UX.

MADE the sixteenth day of September in the year of our Lord one thousand nine hundred and thirty-one (1931). Between MAE E. JONES, widow, (being the widow of George W. PITTS, his wife, of Dravosburg, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, parties of the second part.

WITNESSETH, that the said party of the first part, in consideration of One ($1.00) Dollar, and other good and valuable considerations, to her paid by the said parties of the second part, does grant, bargain, sell and convey unto the said parties of the second part, their heirs and assigns:

[Detailed property description with measurements follows]

THIS conveyance is made under and subject to that certain oil and gas lease covering the above described land as now held and owned by Carnegie Natural Gas Company. detailed_results.ocr_text:
=== PAGE 1 ===
THIS INDENTURE
Made the 14th day of June in the year of our Lord, one thousand nine hundred and sixty-five (1965)

Between JOSEPH B. McLAUGHLIN, also known as JOSEPH T. McLAUGHLIN, widower, of Allegheny Township, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania, and J. MARY McLAUGHLIN, also known as MARY McLAUGHLIN, Patricia McLAUGHLIN, his wife, of the City of Arnold, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania,

parties of the first part and

BUCKEYE STATE, INC., a corporation created by and existing under the laws of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, having its domicile in the City of New Kensington, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania,

party of the second part:

WITNESSETH, that the said parties of the first part, in consideration of One and no/100 ($1.00) - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Dollar

to them now paid by the said party of the second part, do grant, bargain, sell and convey unto the said party of the second part, its successors and assigns,

ALL their undivided two-thirds (2/3) interest of, in and to all those two certain contiguous tracts of land situate in the Township of Allegheny, County of Westmoreland and Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, bounded and described as follows, to-wit:

TRACT NO. 1: BEGINNING at a point where the said tract corners with land now or formerly of John Sloops and land now or formerly of - - - Miller,; thence along the line of land of John Sloops North 11° East 311.50 feet to a point; thence North 60° East 183.15 feet to a post; thence North 7° East 425 feet to a post; thence along the line of land formerly of J. E. McGary by the following courses and distances: North 87° East 391.05 feet to a post; thence North 10° East 558.75 feet to a post; thence North 87° West 427 feet to a post; thence North 84° East 610.5 feet to a post; thence North 11° West 365.25 feet to a post; thence North 72° 30' East 879.85 feet to a post on the line of land now or formerly of William McLaughlin heirs; thence along the line of said William McLaughlin heirs South 10° 30' East 1534 feet to a post; thence South West about 991.95 feet to a post; thence South 7° West 1147.15 feet to a post on the line of land now or formerly of the Foster heirs; thence along the line of said Foster heirs and land now or formerly of E. J. Miller South 85° West 1295.25 feet to a post; thence North 20° 30' West 1089 feet to a post; thence along the line now or formerly of the Miller farm North 81° 30' West 1320 feet to a post, the place of beginning. CONTAINING 121 Acres 100 perches.

TRACT NO. 2: BEING all of that certain tract of land situate in Allegheny Township, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania, commencing at a post on the line running from the top of the hill above the McLaughlin house to and connecting with lands formerly of George Slonaker, now John Sloops; thence along the line of land described under Tract No. 1 by the following courses: South 9° East, 38 perches to a post; thence South 84½° East, 34.5 perches to a post; thence North 10° West, 35.6 perches to a post; thence East 15 perches to the place of beginning. Containing 3 acres and 57 perches.

=== PAGE 2 ===
VOL 1940 PAGE 769

BEING the same premises which Samuel McLaughlin acquired by deeds recorded in the Recorder's office of Westmoreland County in Deed Book Volume 60, page 338 and Deed Book Volume 86, page 310 (Tract No. 1) and Deed Book Volume 93, page 477 (Tract No. 2). Thereafter, Samuel McLaughlin died testate on September 26, 1899, seized of the premises, and by his Will recorded in the Register of Wills office in said Westmoreland County, in Will Book Volume 11, page 121, devised the tract in equal shares, unto his sons, Samuel H. McLaughlin and Joseph S. McLaughlin, share and share alike. Thereafter, the said Samuel H. McLaughlin died testate on September 6, 1926, and by his Will recorded in the Register's office aforesaid in Will Book Volume 23, page 477, devised the premises unto his brother, the said Joseph S. McLaughlin. Thereafter, the said Joseph S. McLaughlin died intestate on April 28, 1939, leaving to survive him as his only heirs at law, M. Josephine McLaughlin, his widow, Dorothy Miller McLaughlin, his daughter, Walter McLaughlin, his son, and Josephine D. McLaughlin, his daughter. Thereafter, the said M. Josephine McLaughlin died testate on March 9, 1954, seized of a one-third interest in the premises, and by her Will recorded in the Register's office aforesaid in Will Book Volume 35, page 399, devised the aforesaid unto her three children, the aforesaid S. Walter McLaughlin, grantors herein and Dorothy Miller McLaughlin, now Dorothy Miller, Administrator of the Estate of Dorothy Miller, deceased, conveying the one-third interest in the premises of Dorothy Miller unto the grantee herein, recorded the same date as this conveyance in the office of the Recorder of Deeds of Westmoreland County.

The actual consideration for this conveyance is $16,500.00.

Excepting and reserving, however, that tract of land containing 81 perches as conveyed by Samuel McLaughlin to his daughter, Mary Ann Silvis, by deed dated February 14, 1898, as recorded in Deed Book Volume 275, page 450, together with that additional land as devised to the said Mary Ann Silvis by the aforesaid will of Samuel McLaughlin dated February 19, 1898, as recorded in Will Book 11, page 121. Further excepting and reserving all restrictions, conveyances, easements and rights of way over and across the premises as may appear in prior instruments of record.

[Document contains tax stamps and an Allegheny Twp. Transfer Tax stamp dated JUN 14 1955]

=== PAGE 3 ===
VL. 1910 PAGE 776

with the appurtenances: To have and to hold the same unto and for the use of the said party of the second part, its successors and assigns forever,

And the said Josephine B. McLaughlin, also known as Josephine B. Fitzgerald, a widow, and Sally McLaughlin, also known as Sally McLaughlin, and Gladys I. McLaughlin, his wife.

for themselves and their heirs, executors and administrators covenant with the said party of the second part, its successors and assigns against all lawful claimants the same and every part thereof to Warrant and Defend.

NOTICE—THIS DOCUMENT MAY NOT SELL, CONVEY, TRANSFER OR INSURE THE TITLE TO THE COAL AND RIGHT OF SUPPORT UNDERNEATH THE SURFACE LAND DESCRIBED OR REFERRED TO HEREIN, AND THE OWNER OR OWNERS OF SUCH COAL MAY HAVE THE COMPLETE LEGAL RIGHT TO REMOVE ALL OF THE COAL, AND, IN THAT CONNECTION, DAMAGE MAY RESULT TO THE SURFACE OF THE LAND AND ANY HOUSE, BUILDING OR OTHER STRUCTURE ON OR IN SUCH LAND. [This notice is set forth in the manner provided in Section 1 of the Act of July 17, 1957, P.L. 984.]

Witness the hand and seal of the said part ies of the first part.

[Multiple signatures with seals]

Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
County of Westmoreland

On this the 17th day of June, A.D. 19 65,

before me the undersigned officer, personally appeared Josephine B. McLaughlin, also known as Josephine B. Fitzgerald, a widow, Sally McLaughlin, also known as Sally McLaughlin and Gladys I. McLaughlin, his wife,

(or satisfactorily proven) to be the person s whose name s are subscribed to the within instrument and acknowledged that they executed the same for the purposes therein contained.

In Witness Whereof, I hereunto set my hand and official seal.
[Notary Public signature and seal]

My commission expires
[Date: 1969]

chunk_analysis.page_text:
THIS INDENTURE
Made the 14th day of June in the year of our Lord, one thousand nine hundred and sixty-five (1965)

Between JOSEPH B. McLAUGHLIN, also known as JOSEPH T. McLAUGHLIN, widower, of Allegheny Township, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania, and J. MARY McLAUGHLIN, also known as MARY McLAUGHLIN, Patricia McLAUGHLIN, his wife, of the City of Arnold, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania,

parties of the first part and

BUCKEYE STATE, INC., a corporation created by and existing under the laws of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, having its domicile in the City of New Kensington, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania,

party of the second part:

WITNESSETH, that the said parties of the first part, in consideration of One and no/100 ($1.00) - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Dollar

to them now paid by the said party of the second part, do grant, bargain, sell and convey unto the said party of the second part, its successors and assigns,

ALL their undivided two-thirds (2/3) interest of, in and to all those two certain contiguous tracts of land situate in the Township of Allegheny, County of Westmoreland and Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, bounded and described as follows, to-wit:

TRACT NO. 1: BEGINNING at a point where the said tract corners with land now or formerly of John Sloops and land now or formerly of - - - Miller,; thence along the line of land of John Sloops North 11° East 311.50 feet to a point; thence North 60° East 183.15 feet to a post; thence North 7° East 425 feet to a post; thence along the line of land formerly of J. E. McGary by the following courses and distances: North 87° East 391.05 feet to a post; thence North 10° East 558.75 feet to a post; thence North 87° West 427 feet to a post; thence North 84° East 610.5 feet to a post; thence North 11° West 365.25 feet to a post; thence North 72° 30' East 879.85 feet to a post on the line of land now or formerly of William McLaughlin heirs; thence along the line of said William McLaughlin heirs South 10° 30' East 1534 feet to a post; thence South West about 991.95 feet to a post; thence South 7° West 1147.15 feet to a post on the line of land now or formerly of the Foster heirs; thence along the line of said Foster heirs and land now or formerly of E. J. Miller South 85° West 1295.25 feet to a post; thence North 20° 30' West 1089 feet to a post; thence along the line now or formerly of the Miller farm North 81° 30' West 1320 feet to a post, the place of beginning. CONTAINING 121 Acres 100 perches.

TRACT NO. 2: BEING all of that certain tract of land situate in Allegheny Township, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania, commencing at a post on the line running from the top of the hill above the McLaughlin house to and connecting with lands formerly of George Slonaker, now John Sloops; thence along the line of land described under Tract No. 1 by the following courses: South 9° East, 38 perches to a post; thence South 84½° East, 34.5 perches to a post; thence North 10° West, 35.6 perches to a post; thence East 15 perches to the place of beginning. Containing 3 acres and 57 perches.

VOL 1940 PAGE 769

BEING the same premises which Samuel McLaughlin acquired by deeds recorded in the Recorder's office of Westmoreland County in Deed Book Volume 60, page 338 and Deed Book Volume 86, page 310 (Tract No. 1) and Deed Book Volume 93, page 477 (Tract No. 2). Thereafter, Samuel McLaughlin died testate on September 26, 1899, seized of the premises, and by his Will recorded in the Register of Wills office in said Westmoreland County, in Will Book Volume 11, page 121, devised the tract in equal shares, unto his sons, Samuel H. McLaughlin and Joseph S. McLaughlin, share and share alike. Thereafter, the said Samuel H. McLaughlin died testate on September 6, 1926, and by his Will recorded in the Register's office aforesaid in Will Book Volume 23, page 477, devised the premises unto his brother, the said Joseph S. McLaughlin. Thereafter, the said Joseph S. McLaughlin died intestate on April 28, 1939, leaving to survive him as his only heirs at law, M. Josephine McLaughlin, his widow, Dorothy Miller McLaughlin, his daughter, Walter McLaughlin, his son, and Josephine D. McLaughlin, his daughter. Thereafter, the said M. Josephine McLaughlin died testate on March 9, 1954, seized of a one-third interest in the premises, and by her Will recorded in the Register's office aforesaid in Will Book Volume 35, page 399, devised the aforesaid unto her three children, the aforesaid S. Walter McLaughlin, grantors herein and Dorothy Miller McLaughlin, now Dorothy Miller, Administrator of the Estate of Dorothy Miller, deceased, conveying the one-third interest in the premises of Dorothy Miller unto the grantee herein, recorded the same date as this conveyance in the office of the Recorder of Deeds of Westmoreland County.

The actual consideration for this conveyance is $16,500.00.

Excepting and reserving, however, that tract of land containing 81 perches as conveyed by Samuel McLaughlin to his daughter, Mary Ann Silvis, by deed dated February 14, 1898, as recorded in Deed Book Volume 275, page 450, together with that additional land as devised to the said Mary Ann Silvis by the aforesaid will of Samuel McLaughlin dated February 19, 1898, as recorded in Will Book 11, page 121. Further excepting and reserving all restrictions, conveyances, easements and rights of way over and across the premises as may appear in prior instruments of record.

[Document contains tax stamps and an Allegheny Twp. Transfer Tax stamp dated JUN 14 1955]

VL. 1910 PAGE 776

with the appurtenances: To have and to hold the same unto and for the use of the said party of the second part, its successors and assigns forever,

And the said Josephine B. McLaughlin, also known as Josephine B. Fitzgerald, a widow, and Sally McLaughlin, also known as Sally McLaughlin, and Gladys I. McLaughlin, his wife.

for themselves and their heirs, executors and administrators covenant with the said party of the second part, its successors and assigns against all lawful claimants the same and every part thereof to Warrant and Defend.

NOTICE—THIS DOCUMENT MAY NOT SELL, CONVEY, TRANSFER OR INSURE THE TITLE TO THE COAL AND RIGHT OF SUPPORT UNDERNEATH THE SURFACE LAND DESCRIBED OR REFERRED TO HEREIN, AND THE OWNER OR OWNERS OF SUCH COAL MAY HAVE THE COMPLETE LEGAL RIGHT TO REMOVE ALL OF THE COAL, AND, IN THAT CONNECTION, DAMAGE MAY RESULT TO THE SURFACE OF THE LAND AND ANY HOUSE, BUILDING OR OTHER STRUCTURE ON OR IN SUCH LAND. [This notice is set forth in the manner provided in Section 1 of the Act of July 17, 1957, P.L. 984.]

Witness the hand and seal of the said part ies of the first part.

[Multiple signatures with seals]

Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
County of Westmoreland

On this the 17th day of June, A.D. 19 65,

before me the undersigned officer, personally appeared Josephine B. McLaughlin, also known as Josephine B. Fitzgerald, a widow, Sally McLaughlin, also known as Sally McLaughlin and Gladys I. McLaughlin, his wife,

(or satisfactorily proven) to be the person s whose name s are subscribed to the within instrument and acknowledged that they executed the same for the purposes therein contained.

In Witness Whereof, I hereunto set my hand and official seal.
[Notary Public signature and seal]

My commission expires
[Date: 1969]

=== PAGE 1 ===
This Indenture

Made the 13th day of June 1990

WEST DEER BIBLE CHURCH, formerly Fundamental Church of West Deer, a non-profit corporation,

non-profit
a Corporation organized and existing under the laws of Commonwealth of Pennsylvania

having its principal place of business in Township of West Deer, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania
(hereinafter called "Grantor")

AND

SHAWN S. CURRY and MARY M. CURRY, his wife
(hereinafter called "Grantee")

Witnesseth, That the said Grantor in consideration of SIX THOUSAND NINE HUNDRED

and no/100 ($6,900.00) ----------------------------------------Dollars,

paid to the Grantor by the Grantee, receipt of which is hereby acknowledged, does grant, bargain, sell

and convey to the said Grantees, their heirs and assigns

All
that certain lot or piece of ground situate in West Deer Township, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, being more particularly described as follows:

Parcel 3 in the West Deer Bible Church Plan of record in the Recorder's Office of Allegheny County, PA. in Plan Book Volume 163, page 109.

BEING a part of the same parcel which the Fundamental Church of West Deer took in two deeds, a 1/3 interest from the Estate of Helen H. Jose by deed dated April 26, 1967, and of record in the Recorder's Office of Allegheny County in Deed Book Volume 4391, page 109 and a 2/3 interest from J. Fred Jose and Janet L. Jose, husband and wife, by deed dated April 26, 1967 and of record in the Recorder's Office of Allegheny County in Deed Book Volume 4480, page 90. The Fundamental Church of West Deer changed its name by Articles of Amendment filed with the Department of State on May 10, 1990, to West Deer Bible Church, the Grantor herein.

VOL. 8277 PAGE 16

=== PAGE 2 ===
M A003251
DEED TRANSFER TAX
County of Allegheny
Township 119 1.00%
West Deer
Date 06/26/1990
Block/Lot
Amt $6900
Rec'd $69.00
Check # HF 037
Michael A. Della Vecchia
County Agent
BY [signature]

S A003251
DEED TRANSFER TAX
County of Allegheny
S. D. 010 0.50%
Deer Lakes
Date 06/26/1990
Block/Lot
Amt $6900
Rec'd $34.50
Check # HG 037
Michael A. Della Vecchia
County Agent
BY [signature]

COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA
DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE
REALTY
TRANSFER JUN1990
TAX [stamp showing $69.00]

VOL. 8277 PAGE 17

=== PAGE 3 ===
with the appurtenances: To Have and To Hold the same to and for the use of the said
Grantee s, their heirs and assigns forever, and the
Grantor, for its successors and assigns, hereby covenants and agrees that it will WARRANT*
GENERALLY the property hereby conveyed.

NOTICE—THIS DOCUMENT MAY NOT SELL, CONVEY, TRANSFER, INCLUDE OR INSURE THE TITLE TO THE COAL AND RIGHT OF SUPPORT UNDERNEATH THE SURFACE LAND DESCRIBED OR REFERRED TO HEREIN, AND THE OWNER OR OWNERS OF SUCH COAL MAY HAVE THE COMPLETE LEGAL RIGHT TO REMOVE ALL OF SUCH COAL AND, IN THAT CONNECTION, DAMAGE MAY RESULT TO THE SURFACE OF THE LAND AND ANY HOUSE, BUILDING OR OTHER STRUCTURE ON OR IN SUCH LAND. THIS INCLUSION OF THIS NOTICE DOES NOT ENLARGE, RESTRICT OR MODIFY ANY LEGAL RIGHTS OR ESTATES OTHERWISE CREATED, TRANSFERRED, EXCEPTED OR RESERVED BY THIS INSTRUMENT. [This notice is set forth in the manner provided in Section 1 of the Act of July 17, 1957, P.L. 984, as amended, and is not intended as notice of unrecorded instruments, if any.]

This Deed is made under and by virtue of a meeting of the Church congregation and a resolution of the of the Grantor duly passed at a regular meeting thereof, held Elders and Deacons on the 13th day of December, A.D. 1989, a full quorum being present, authorizing and directing the same to be done.

In Witness Whereof, The said Grantor has caused its common and corporate seal to be affixed to these presents by the hand of Harold Piovesan, Elder and David J. Gilson, Deacon.

Attest:
WEST DEER BIBLE CHURCH
(Name of Corporation)

By Harold Piovesan, Elder
By David J. Gilson, Deacon

NOTICE THE UNDERSIGNED, AS EVIDENCED BY THE SIGNATURE(S) TO THIS NOTICE AND THE ACCEPTANCE AND RECORDING OF THIS DEED, (IS, ARE) FULLY COGNIZANT OF THE FACT THAT THE UNDERSIGNED MAY NOT BE OBTAINING THE RIGHT OF PROTECTION AGAINST SUBSIDENCE, AS TO THE PROPERTY HEREIN CONVEYED, RESULTING FROM COAL MINING OPERATIONS AND THAT THE PURCHASED PROPERTY, HEREIN CONVEYED, MAY BE PROTECTED FROM DAMAGE DUE TO MINE SUBSIDENCE BY A PRIVATE CONTRACT WITH THE OWNERS OF THE ECONOMIC INTEREST IN THE COAL. THIS NOTICE IS INSERTED HEREIN TO COMPLY WITH THE BITUMINOUS MINE SUBSIDENCE AND LAND CONSERVATION ACT OF 1966.

WITNESS OR ATTEST:
Shayne S. Curry
Mary M. Curry

*If general warranty deed is desired, insert GENERALLY.
If special warranty deed is desired, insert SPECIALLY.

VOL. 8277 PAGE 18

=== PAGE 4 ===
Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
County of Allegheny

On this 13 day of June, A.D. 19 90, before me a Notary Public the undersigned officer, personally appeared Harold Plovesan, Elder and David J. Gilson, who acknowledged themselves to be the representatives of WEST DEER BIBLE CHURCH, a non-profit corporation, and that they as such Elder and Deacon, being authorized to do so, executed the foregoing instrument for the purposes therein contained by signing the name of the corporation by themselves as Harold Plovesan, Elder and David J. Gilson, Deacon

In witness whereof, I hereunto set my hand and official seal.

[Notary Seal]
JANET ROGERS, NOTARY PUBLIC
WEST DEER TWP., ALLEGHENY COUNTY
MY COMMISSION EXPIRES APRIL 13, 1992
Member, Pennsylvania Association of Notaries

CERTIFICATE OF RESIDENCE
I hereby certify that the precise residence of the grantee herein is:
R.D #7 Box 351A Singley Road Tarentum Pa 15084
[Signature] For Grantee

[Recorder Stamp Details]
Vol. 8277
Recorded Jun 26 90 71648

Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
County of Allegheny

Recorded on this 26th day of June A.D. 19 90, in the Recorder's Office of the said County, in Deed Book, Vol. 8277, page 16

Given under my hand and the seal of the said office the day and year aforesaid.
[Signature] Recorder

VOL. 8277 PAGE 19
